page.title: 18Witchampton Paper Board Mill
page.content: The Mill is on the site of one of the two flour mills mentioned in the Domesday Book. It has been producing paper since the early 1700's. In the early days it was solely operated by water power but automation has now almost taken over. The very early products were made from rope and hemp all being air dried, then wood pulp was introduced and cartridge paper was manufactured.Modern day products include 'Cotacard', paperback book covers, record sleeves, labels for Marks and Spencers and soap wrappers. The mill is now run as a co_operative with Wimborne Council. It employs 50 people of whom very few are actually local residents.The siting of the mill has resulted in a large number of heavy lorries passing through the village. Other than farming the mill is the only local industry.
